Class RedBlackTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • DefaultBinaryTree<T>
      • DefaultBinarySearchTree<T>
        • RedBlackTree<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BinarySearchTree<T>, BinaryTree<T>

    public class RedBlackTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends DefaultBinarySearchTree<T>
implements BinarySearchTree<T>
    RedBlackTree creates a BinarySearchTree that maintains certain properties. It must have a black root, every node must be red or black, a red node must have two black nodes as children, and every path to a leaf must contain the same number of black nodes. After inserting, the tree goes to the method fixClashes() to restructure if necessary.

      • validateTree

        public int validateTree(RedBlackTreeNode currentNode,
                        int currentPathBlack,
                        int totalPathBlack)
        Checks that red nodes have only black roots and that there are the same number of black nodes on all paths.
        Parameters:
        currentNode - the node being looked at
        currentPathBlack - the number of black nodes encountered on this path
        totalPathBlack - the total number of nodes that should be encountered on a path
        Returns:
        totalPathBlack to make sure the number stays updated
